name: additionalDescriptiveSize
definition: An alphanumeric size factor the brand owner wishes to communicate to the consumer.
avpNonMigrationReason: Migration issues with request. It was not a backwards compatible change.

name: additiveStatementFormattingPattern
definition: the formatting pattern of text for additive statement to denote a paragraph breaks. It will be up to the recipient to determine the formatting style they will use.
guidance1:
Depends on FoodAndBeverageMarketingInformationExtension.compulsoryAdditivesLabelInformation being populated.
This AVP must start with a language qualifier. OPTIONAL: This AVP is only recommended to  start with a language qualifier when multiple languages are needed in a target market. The language qualifier must be a code from the ISO 639_1 codelist, and is delimited by a colon (":"), after which the actual payload is inserted. E.g. "en:" see example
Can be repeated for language only, not for different values.Until Major Release only "p" should be used.
businessRuleRationale: additive statement should be populated, p should only be used at this time

name: allergenStatementFormattingPattern
definition: the formatting pattern of text for allergen statement to generically emphasize a word or set of words and to denote a paragraph break. It will be up to the recipient to determine the formatting style they will use for the emphasized text.
guidance1:
Depends on the allergenStatement being populated.
OPTIONAL: This AVP is only recommended to  start with a language qualifier when multiple languages are needed in a target market. The language qualifier must be a code from the ISO 639_1 codelist, and is delimited by a colon (":"), after which the actual payload is inserted. E.g. "en:" see example
Until Major Release only "p" and "em" should be used.
This AVP is repeatable for language only, not for multiple  values.
businessRuleRationale: allergen statement should be populated, p and em should only be used at this time

name: consumerUsageInstructionsFormattingPattern
definition: The formatting pattern of text for consumer usage instructions to generically emphasize a word or set of words and to denote a paragraph break. It will be up to the recipient to determine the formatting style they will use for the emphasized text.
guidance1: Depends on the consumerUsageInstructions AVP being populated.
guidance2: OPTIONAL: This AVP is only recommended to  start with a language qualifier when multiple languages are needed in a target market. The language qualifier must be a code from the ISO 639_1 codelist, and is delimited by a colon (":"), after which the actual payload is inserted. E.g. "en:" see example. This AVP may be repeated for language only.
businessRuleRationale: consumer usage instructions should be populated, p and em should only be used at this time

name: extendedImportClassification
definition: EU classification of the products that are subjected to excise duties
guidance1:
The value of this AVP follows the pattern : Code: classification 
Example: <value name="extendedImportClassification">EU_EXCISE_PRODUCT_CODE:S400</value>
guidance2: Click here for the code values for this AVP

name: ingredientStatementFormattingPattern
definition: The formatting pattern of text for ingredient statement to generically emphasize a word or set of words and to denote a paragraph break. It will be up to the recipient to determine the formatting style they will use for the emphasized text.
guidance1:
Depends on the allergenStatement being populated.
OPTIONAL: This AVP is only recommended to  start with a language qualifier when multiple languages are needed in a target market. The language qualifier must be a code from the ISO 639_1 codelist, and is delimited by a colon (":"), after which the actual payload is inserted. E.g. "en:" see example
Until Major Release only "p" and "em" should be used.
businessRuleRationale: ingredient statement should be populated, p and em should only be used at this time

name: nonApparelStyleTypeDescription
definition: describes the style of non apparel GTINs that share many of the similar characteristics  and are recognizable types of products by the consumer.
avpNonMigrationReason: Attributes/class cannot be renamed in 3.1.3: apparel class
rationaleForAVPCreation: Add the following attributes to support Walmart B2C website

name: preparationInstructionsFormattingPattern
definition: The formatting pattern of text for preparation instructions to denote a paragraph breaks. It will be up to the recipient to determine the formatting style they will use.
guidance1:
This AVP depends on the population of the attribute preparationInstructions. 
OPTIONAL: This AVP is only recommended to  start with a language qualifier when multiple languages are needed in a target market. The language qualifier must be a code from the ISO 639_1 codelist, and is delimited by a colon (":"), after which the actual payload is inserted. E.g. "en:" see example
Can be repeated for language only.
businessRuleRationale: preparation instructions should be populated,  p should only be used at this time

name: gHSSymbolCode
definition:
A code depicting the symbols which convey health, physical and
environmental hazard information, assigned to a hazard class and
category for example GHS.
Pictograms & codes include the harmonized hazard symbols plus other graphic elements, such as borders, background patterns or colours that are intended to convey specific information.
Examples of all the pictograms and downloadable files for GHS can be
accessed on the UN website for the GHS.
avpNonMigrationReason: Would require complete restructuring of class
rationaleForAVPCreation: To support the regulation Classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures CLP in the EU we need to modify the Safety Data Sheet Module / GHS (Global Harmonization System) Detail class

name: gHSClassificationStatement
definition:
In the case of a substance or mixture, the classification which arises from the application of the
classification rules. Where the supplier has notified information regarding the substance or mixture to the classification and labelling inventory.
avpNonMigrationReason: Would require complete restructuring of class
rationaleForAVPCreation: To support the regulation Classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures CLP in the EU we need to modify the Safety Data Sheet Module / GHS (Global Harmonization System) Detail class

name: isHazardStatementLabelElement
definition: Specifies if the HazardousStatement Code and description are included in the Labeling section of the Safety Data Sheet
rationaleForAVPCreation: To support the regulation Classification, labelling and packaging of substances and mixtures CLP in the EU we need to modify the Safety Data Sheet Module / GHS (Global Harmonization System) Detail class

name: packageDateReasonType
definition: To specify the reason the packaging date was applied to the packaging.
guidance1: Click here for the Code Values for this AVP.
avpNonMigrationReason: Required possible restructuring of PackageDate Class due to other attributes.

name: tradeItemGroupIdentificationDescription
definition: Descriptive text to group similar products.
avpNonMigrationReason: Migration issues with request. It was not a backwards compatible change.
rationaleForAVPCreation:
Current mapping doesn't make sense:
tradeItemGroupIdentificationCodeReference >tradeItemGroupIdentificationCodeReference
tradeItemGroupIdentificationDescription> tradeItemGroupIdentificationCodeReference/codeDescription
This should be a descriptive text t
